Package edu.missouri.geom

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mmkrusniak.geom.Point
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Displayable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Coordinate, Detectable
    public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
implements Displayable
    An n-dimensional Cartesian point. (For most uses, however, only two or three dimensions are supported). Like all geometry components, Point is immutable; once created a Point cannot be modified. The coordinate system is y-down, x-right.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      static int CROSS
      Render style argument which draws points as a small X.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Renders the point as a string. The format is an ordered set, with decimals truncated to two places.
        Overrides:

      • distance2D

        public double distance2D​(Line l)
        The distance of this point from a line. If the line is infinite in one or two directions, that is respected and the resulting point may not necessarily lie between the two points defining the line.
        Parameters:
        l - A line.
        Returns:
        The distance of this point from the line.

      • distance3D

        public double distance3D​(Line l)

      • rotate

        public Point rotate​(double theta)
        Rotates this point about the origin.
        Parameters:
        theta - The amount of rotation, in radians. (Note that since y points down in this coordinate system, increasing the amount of rotation makes for a clockwise, not counterclockwise, spin.
        Returns:
        A point which is the result of rotating this one theta degress about the origin.

      • rotate

        public Point rotate​(double theta,
                    Point c)
        Rotates this point about another point.
        Parameters:
        c - A point about which to rotate.
        theta - The amount of rotation, in radians. (Note that since y points down in this coordinate system, increasing the amount of rotation makes for a clockwise, not counterclockwise, spin.
        Returns:
        A point which is the result of rotating this one theta degress about c.

      • sqDistance

        public double sqDistance​(Point other,
                         int dim)
        Gives the distance from this point to another, squared. It's preferable to compare squared distances rather than normal ones in many cases, since taking the square root of a distance is a long and unnecessary operation in that case.
        Parameters:
        other - A point.
        Returns:
        The distance from this point to another, squared.

      • bearing

        public double bearing​(Point p)
        Gives the bearing from another point to this one (in radians), where zero is directly right, PI/2 is directly down, etc.
        Parameters:
        p - A point.
        Returns:
        The bearing from another point to this one..

      • render

        public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Renders the point in the default style - a small dot.
        Parameters:
        g - A graphics instance on which to draw.

      • render

        public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   int style)
        Renders the point in a specific style. The style constants are within this class.
        Parameters:
        g - A graphics canvas on which to render.
        style - A style constant which determines how the point is drawn.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object p)
        Gives whether a Point is "equal" to another. Functionally, points which are equal have X and Y distance no greater than GRANULARITY. Z distance is currently disconsidered. Returns false for non-Point objects.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        p - An object to compare to.
        Returns:
        Whether the two points are approximately in the same two-dimensional location.

      • toAWTPoint

        public java.awt.Point toAWTPoint()
        Represents this Point as a Java AWT Point object. AWT points use integer positions, so using this is not recommended except for graphics purposes.
        Returns:
        This point as a java.awt.Point.

      • toSquare

        public Polygon toSquare​(double width)
        Gives a Polygon which forms a square around this point of a specified width around the point. (The full width of the square will be twice the parameter.)
        Parameters:
        width - A distance of each side of the square from the point.
        Returns:
        A square around the point.

      • extend

        public Point extend​(double... c)
        Generates a new Point with additional coordinate data. The point is the same to this one in the dimensions that this one has, and also includes additional values as given by the parameters.
        Parameters:
        c - One or more coordinate values to append to this point.
        Returns:
        A new point that is the result of appending those values to this one.
